biography.title: The Mind That Knew No Boundaries
paragraphs: Born in Vinci in 1452, Leonardo da Vinci embodied the Renaissance ideal of universal knowledge. He pursued mastery in art, science, engineering, anatomy, architecture, and countless other fields with equal passion and revolutionary insight. His curiosity knew no bounds, his notebooks reveal a mind centuries ahead of its time.

Leonardo approached art with scientific rigor and science with artistic vision. He dissected corpses to understand anatomy, studied birds to design flying machines, and observed water to paint landscapes. His method of inquiry—observation, experimentation, documentation—was as revolutionary as his creations.

Though he completed relatively few paintings, works like the Mona Lisa and The Last Supper remain among humanity's most iconic images. His notebooks, filled with inventions from helicopters to tanks, from scuba gear to robots, demonstrate an intellect that transcended his era. Leonardo didn't just contribute to the Renaissance—he defined what it meant to be a complete human being.

skills.title: Painting
skills.description: Master of sfumato, perspective, and human emotion, creating works of unparalleled subtlety and psychological depth.

skills.title: Scientific Investigation
skills.description: Pioneering anatomist, engineer, and natural philosopher who documented the world with unprecedented detail and insight.

skills.title: Engineering & Invention
skills.description: Visionary who conceptualized flying machines, submarines, robots, and countless devices centuries before their realization.

masterworks.title: Mona Lisa
masterworks.description: The world's most famous painting—a portrait of enigmatic beauty that has captivated humanity for five centuries.

masterworks.title: The Last Supper
masterworks.description: A revolutionary mural capturing Christ's final meal with dramatic composition and psychological intensity unmatched in art.

masterworks.title: Vitruvian Man
masterworks.description: The iconic drawing merging art and science, depicting ideal human proportions based on ancient texts and meticulous observation.

masterworks.title: The Virgin of the Rocks
masterworks.description: A masterpiece of atmospheric perspective and spiritual symbolism, showcasing Leonardo's innovative painting techniques.

masterworks.title: Anatomical Studies
masterworks.description: Groundbreaking drawings revealing the human body's inner workings with accuracy not matched for centuries.

masterworks.title: Flying Machine Designs
masterworks.description: Visionary concepts for human flight, including ornithopters and aerial screws, predating aviation by 400 years.

legacy.title: Timeless Vision
legacy.description: Leonardo da Vinci represents the pinnacle of human intellectual achievement—a mind that refused to accept boundaries between disciplines. His fusion of art and science created a new way of understanding the world. From aviation engineers studying his flying machines to artists analyzing his techniques, from anatomists appreciating his drawings to inventors following his methods, Leonardo's influence permeates modern civilization. He proved that curiosity, observation, and imagination can unlock limitless human potential.
